user.title: Connect to Elk-M1 Control
user.description: Choose a discovered system or 'Manual Entry' if no devices have been discovered.

data_description.device: Select a discovered Elk-M1 control system to configure or choose Manual Entry to enter connection details.

manual_connection.title: [%key:component::elkm1::config::step::user::title%]
manual_connection.description: The address string must be in the form 'address[:port]' for 'secure' and 'non-secure'. Example: '192.168.1.1'. The port is optional and defaults to 2101 for 'non-secure' and 2601 for 'secure'. For the serial protocol, the address must be in the form 'tty[:baud]'. Example: '/dev/ttyS1'. The baud is optional and defaults to 115200.

data.address: The IP address or domain or serial port if connecting via serial.
data.prefix: A unique prefix (leave blank if you only have one Elk-M1).

data_description.protocol: Protocol to use when connecting to the Elk-M1 (secure, non-secure, serial, etc.).
data_description.address: IP address, domain name, or serial device path. For serial use format 'tty[:baud]'.
data_description.username: The username to authenticate with the Elk-M1 panel.
data_description.password: The password to authenticate with the Elk-M1 panel.
data_description.prefix: Optional unique prefix to distinguish multiple Elk-M1 panels.
data_description.temperature_unit: Unit used by the Elk-M1 for temperature values (C or F).
